DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Site Surgical Procedure Condition Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the procedure or condition occurring during or immediately after the surgical procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Domain Surgical Site Surgical Procedure Condition
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure._The anatomical site on which surgery was performed._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A state of being, such as a state of health.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: The anatomical site on which surgery was performed.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:A state of being, such as a state of health.

Concepts.definition: The anatomical site on which surgery was performed.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A state of being, such as a state of health.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released. AK 2020-6-11; Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The name that describe the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, palliative effects and/or state of health.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical construction of an artificial opening (stoma) for external fistulization of a duct or vessel by insertion of a tube with or without a supportive stent.: The particular portion of space occupied by a physical object or intended for a physical object.

Concepts.definition: Surgical creation of an opening in an organ.
The particular portion of space occupied by a physical object or intended for a physical object.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A ring-shaped muscle that relaxes or tightens to open or close a passage or opening in the body. Examples are the anal sphincter (around the opening of the anus) and the pyloric sphincter (at the lower opening of the stomach).: The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.

Concepts.definition: A circular band of muscle that functions to regulate the size of an orifice in the body.
The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.: Undamaged in any way; whole.

Concepts.definition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity.: Removed; taken out of or separated from.

Concepts.definition: The systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity.
Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity.: The particular portion of space occupied by a physical object or intended for a physical object.

Concepts.definition: The systematic withdrawal of fluids and discharges from a wound, sore or cavity.
The particular portion of space occupied by a physical object or intended for a physical object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:A state of being, such as a state of health.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
A state of being, such as a state of health.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 3123098 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for CDISC aligned NCI Standard CRF task. ghd
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 02.13.23_Set Reg Status to Standard for all CDISC Aligned content_ghd
